content:
Mr. Raphael G. Warnock, from the State of Georgia, called the Senate to order at 10 a.m., the Chaplain offered a prayer, and Mr. Warnock led the Senate in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag of the United States of America.
The Journal
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date. 
Certain Procedures Dispensed With
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
Transaction of Morning Business
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.
Legislative Business (Tuesday, July 20)
 H.R. 1652
 (Rep. Nadler)
        A bill to deposit certain funds into the Crime Victims Fund, to waive matching requirements, and for other purposes.
        -- Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
        -- Passed Senate, under the order of 7/14/21, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 100 - 0. Record Vote Number 
 S.Amdt. 2121
 (Sen. Toomey)
        To ensure adequate funding in the Crime Victims Fund is disbursed to victims, their families, and their advocates each year.
        --Amendment SA 2121 proposed by Senator Durbin for Senator Toomey. 
        --Amendment SA 2121, as modified, not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 40 - 60. Record Vote Number 
 S.Res. 291
 (Sen. Inhofe)
        A resolution congratulating the University of Oklahoma Sooners softball team on winning the 2021 National Collegiate Athletic Association Women's College World Series.
        -- Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation discharged by Unanimous Consent.
        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
 S.Res. 307
 (Sen. Wicker)
        A resolution congratulating the Mississippi State University baseball team on winning the 2021 National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I baseball championship.
        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
 S.Res. 308
 (Sen. Moran)
        A resolution commending and congratulating the Hutchinson Community College Blue Dragons football team for winning the 2021 National Junior College Athletic Association football National Championship.
        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
Executive Business (Tuesday, July 20)
 PN126
        Jennifer Ann Abruzzo, of New York, to be General Counsel of the National Labor Relations Board for a term of four years
        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 50. Record Vote Number 
        -- Considered by Senate.
        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate and vote 7/21/2021.
 PN423
        Kenneth Allen Polite, Jr., of Louisiana, to be an Assistant Attorney General
        -- Considered by Senate.
        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 57 - 43. Record Vote Number 
        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 56 - 44. Record Vote Number 
Adjournment
Under the authority of the order of today, at  715 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Ms. Hassan in the chair) declared the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 1030 a.m. tomorrow.

The President pro tempore called the Senate to order at 10 a.m., the Chaplain offered a prayer, and the President pro tempore led the Senate in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag of the United States of America.
The Journal
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date. 
Certain Procedures Dispensed With
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
Transaction of Morning Business
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.
Legislative Business (Thursday, July 15)
 S. 658
 (Sen. Cornyn)
        A bill to authorize the Secretary of Homeland Security to work with cybersecurity consortia for training, and for other purposes.
        -- Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
        -- Message on Senate action sent to the House.
 S.Res. 306
 (Sen. Schumer)
        A resolution to authorize representation by the Senate Legal Counsel in the case of Jennifer Grappell v. Alberto M. Carvalho, et al.
        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
Executive Business (Thursday, July 15)
 PN126
        Jennifer Ann Abruzzo, of New York, to be General Counsel of the National Labor Relations Board for a term of four years
        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.
        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.
 PN389
        Tiffany P. Cunningham, of Illinois, to be United States Circuit Judge for the Federal Circuit
        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 63 - 34. Record Vote Number 
        -- Considered by Senate.
        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate and vote 7/19/2021.
 PN414
        J. Nellie Liang, of Maryland, to be an Under Secretary of the Treasury
        -- Considered by Senate.
        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 72 - 27. Record Vote Number 
 PN423
        Kenneth Allen Polite, Jr., of Louisiana, to be an Assistant Attorney General
        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.
        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.
 PN460
        Donald Michael Remy, of Louisiana, to be Deputy Secretary of Veterans Affairs
        -- Considered by Senate.
        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 91 - 8. Record Vote Number 
Adjournment
Under the authority of the order of today, at  336 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Ms. Cortez Masto in the chair) declared the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until  3 p.m. on Monday, July 19, 2021.

Ms. Mazie K. Hirono, from the State of Hawaii, called the Senate to order at  3 p.m., the Chaplain offered a prayer, and Ms. Hirono led the Senate in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag of the United States of America.
The Journal
Pursuant to the order of Thursday, July 15, 2021,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date. 
Certain Procedures Dispensed With
Pursuant to the order of Thursday, July 15, 2021, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
Transaction of Morning Business
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.
Legislative Business (Monday, July 19)
 H.R. 3684
 (Rep. DeFazio)
        A bill to authorize funds for Federal-aid highways , highway safety programs, and transit programs, and for other purposes.
        -- Motion to proceed to consideration of measure made in Senate.
        -- Cloture motion on the motion to proceed to the measure presented in Senate.
Executive Business (Monday, July 19)
 PN242
        Bonnie D. Jenkins, of New York, to be Under Secretary of State for Arms Control and International Security
        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.
        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII.
 PN389
        Tiffany P. Cunningham, of Illinois, to be United States Circuit Judge for the Federal Circuit
        -- Considered by Senate.
        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 63 - 33. Record Vote Number 
Adjournment
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Schumer, at  724 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
